Introduction to package containerit

Daniel Nüst

2018-03-25

Source: vignettes/basic.Rmd

Introduction

This R extension package provides features to bundle an R analysis together with the required runtime environment in so called software containers, more specifically Docker. The intention of this package is to provide a building block to support reproducible and archivable research. Development is supported by the DFG-funded project Opening Reproducible Research (http://o2r.info).

The core functionality is to create a Dockerfile from a given R session, script, or workspace directory. This Dockerfile contains all the R packages and their system dependencies required by the R workflow to be packaged.

The Dockerfiles are based on rocker (on Docker Hub). Eventually it should/could be possible to create images from scratch?

Dockerfile generation relies on the sysreqs package.

To build images and run containers, this package integrates with the harbor package.

For nitty gritty things like reading/loading/installing the exact versions, including system dependencies, internal and external libraries etc., this project is focused on the geospatial domain.

tl;dr

Load the package, do your analysis, and create a Dockerfile.

library("containerit")
## 
## Attaching package: 'containerit'
## The following object is masked from 'package:base':
## 
##     Arg
# do stuff, based on demo("krige")
library("gstat")
library("sp")

data(meuse)
coordinates(meuse) = ~x+y
data(meuse.grid)
gridded(meuse.grid) = ~x+y
v <- variogram(log(zinc)~1, meuse)
m <- fit.variogram(v, vgm(1, "Sph", 300, 1))
plot(v, model = m)

container <- dockerfile(from = sessionInfo())
## INFO [2018-03-25 15:34:33] Going online? TRUE  ... to retrieve system dependencies (sysreq-api)
## INFO [2018-03-25 15:34:33] Trying to determine system requirements for the package(s) 'sp,gstat,Rcpp,rstudioapi,knitr,xml2,magrittr,roxygen2,MASS,lattice,FNN,R6,rlang,stringr,xts,semver,lambda.r,futile.logger,intervals,htmltools,commonmark,yaml,rprojroot,digest,assertthat,pkgdown,crayon,futile.options,fs,memoise,evaluate,rmarkdown,stringi,desc,backports,spacetime,zoo,remotes' from sysreqs online DB
## INFO [2018-03-25 15:34:35] Adding CRAN packages: assertthat, backports, commonmark, crayon, desc, digest, evaluate, FNN, fs, futile.logger, futile.options, gstat, htmltools, intervals, knitr, lambda.r, lattice, magrittr, MASS, memoise, R6, Rcpp, remotes, rlang, rmarkdown, roxygen2, rprojroot, rstudioapi, semver, sp, spacetime, stringi, stringr, xml2, xts, yaml, zoo
## INFO [2018-03-25 15:34:35] Adding GitHub packages: r-lib/pkgdown@5e4825875751c009444c56ce43d06324ec53e910
## INFO [2018-03-25 15:34:35] Created Dockerfile-Object based on sessionInfo

The Dockerfile object can be saved to a file or printed out.

cat(as.character(format(container)), sep = "\n")
## FROM rocker/r-ver:3.4.4                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
## LABEL maintainer="daniel"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
## RUN export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive; apt-get -y update \
##   && apt-get install -y git-core \
##  libxml2-dev \
##  make \
##  pandoc \
##  pandoc-citeproc                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
## RUN ["install2.r", "assertthat", "backports", "commonmark", "crayon", "desc", "digest", "evaluate", "FNN", "fs", "futile.logger", "futile.options", "gstat", "htmltools", "intervals", "knitr", "lambda.r", "lattice", "magrittr", "MASS", "memoise", "R6", "Rcpp", "remotes", "rlang", "rmarkdown", "roxygen2", "rprojroot", "rstudioapi", "semver", "sp", "spacetime", "stringi", "stringr", "xml2", "xts", "yaml", "zoo"]
## RUN ["installGithub.r", "r-lib/pkgdown@5e4825875751c009444c56ce43d06324ec53e910"]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
## WORKDIR /payload/                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
## CMD ["R"]
write(container, file = tempfile())
## INFO [2018-03-25 15:34:35] Writing dockerfile to /tmp/RtmpjjPJfF/file4fab5415f1a3

Dockerfile examples

The following demos use the rgdal package because it has system library dependencies, namely GDAL and PROJ.4. Code snippets are taken from the sp gallery.

Here is some regular R code loading a file and plotting it.

library("rgdal")
library("maptools")

nc <- rgdal::readOGR(system.file("shapes/", package="maptools"), "sids", verbose = FALSE)
proj4string(nc) <- CRS("+proj=longlat +datum=NAD27")
plot(nc)

Create Dockerfile from session

class(sessionInfo())
## [1] "sessionInfo"
containerit::dockerfile(from = sessionInfo(), env = ls())
## INFO [2018-03-25 15:34:37] Going online? TRUE  ... to retrieve system dependencies (sysreq-api)

Script

scriptFile <- tempfile(pattern = "containerit_", fileext = ".R")
file <- file(scriptFile)
writeLines(c('nc <- rgdal::readOGR(system.file("shapes/", package="maptools"), "sids", verbose = FALSE)',
             'proj4string(nc) <- CRS("+proj=longlat +datum=NAD27")',
             'plot(nc)'), file)
close(file)
class(file)
## [1] "file"       "connection"
#containerit::dockerfile(from = file)

Workspace

Go through all .R files in a directory and create a Dockerfile with a runtime environment which can run all of them.

workspace <- getwd()
class(workspace)
## [1] "character"
dir.exists(workspace)
## [1] TRUE
#containerit::dockerfile(from = workspace)

sessionInfo()
